sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph G:

![graph](https://i.imgur.com/tH4a4FK.png)

Is there a Hamiltonian cycle in G? If so, what is it?
message_2:
Yes, there is a Hamiltonian cycle in the given graph G. A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once.

One possible Hamiltonian cycle in G is: A → B → C → F → E → D → A

This cycle visits every vertex exactly once and returns to the starting vertex A, forming a closed loop.
